intro: Fumaria agraria proles major, commonly known as the greater celandine, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and broad, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. Fumaria agraria proles major is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along roadsides.
